page.title: 16FOOTPATHS
page.content: This block is well served with public rights of way and they are mostly in good condition, though farmers sometimes seem reluctant to reestablish footpaths after ploughing. It is possible to follow almost the whole length of the Loose Valley along the stream and it makes a very pleasant an untaxing walk. Crossing this east-west route is the line of an old Roman road which ran from Rochester through Maidstone and on to Hastings; parts of it are still marked by footpaths and lanes. Another attractive route with extensive views over the Weald passes through Loddington Farm and follows the Greensand Ridge. The Maidstone branch of the Ramblers' Association, the Loose Footpaths Group, and the Suttons Strollers all organize regular walks in this area.
